ExternalReference: Strategic Planning, Assessment, Data Analytics, and Technology

FY1920.ExternalReference: Strategic Planning, Assessment, Data Analytics, and Technology
FY1920.Q83:
1.	The Office explored best practices and technology applications available.; 2.	The Office is in the process of designing an integrated framework that combines similar university wide goal setting and outcome/assessment processes to achieve administrative efficiency.
3.	The Office developed a preliminary Teams/SharePoint system of data collection.  We are in the process of transitioning to an easy to use HTML structure.
4.	Additionally, we adopted Monday.com and Teams to efficiently manage tasks and initiatives lead by our Office.
FY1920.Q84: The Office will continue to streamline the multiple goal-setting and assessment processes that impact the Division and our Office.
FY1920.Q93:
GRANTS DEVELOPMENT 

Awards 
1. 11 SUNY COVID Seed Funding Team Awards (25 Applications Overall) 
2. Two $50,000 SUNY Center Scale Grants (Downstate HD and Extreme Weather) 
3. $44,000 National Science Foundation Grant – RISE 2019 
4. $25,000 Environmental Protection Agency Grant – RISE 2019 5. $78,000 Multi-Sponsored Funds – RISE 2019 
6. $5,000 Climate Solutions Acceleration Fund – ARC-X 

Proposals 
1. $7M NIMHD P50 Center of Excellence in Health Disparities 
2. $25M Science and Technology Center (Stakeholder-driven Adaptive Modeling for Flood Extremes and Resiliency (SAFER) Science & Technology Center) 
3. $60,000 SUNY ITG ARC-X Technology Initiative Pending Review 1. $23M NIMHD RCMI U54 in COVID Health Disparities (w/SUNY Downstate) 
2. $5M PCORI Telehealth Medicine Study (w/SUNY Downstate) HOSTED 

NATIONAL CONFERENCE:
RISE 2019: TRANSFORMING UNIVERSITY ENGAGEMENT IN PRE AND POST DISASTER ENVIRONMENTS 
1. Just under 500 participants from over 170 Institutions including 114 Universities and Colleges 
2. 24 Chancellors and University Presidents participated including five from Puerto Rico 
3. SUNY Chancellor Johnson and SUNY Chancellor Rodriquez were Honorary Chairs 
4. Over 53 plenary and panel sessions and over 180+ speakers 
5. Extensive Media Coverage including Inside Higher Education 
6. Social Media Analytics – Over 550 tweets and 2.5 million impressions 
7. Video and Photo Galleries 
a. Plenary Videos: www.albany.edu/rise2019/relive-rise.html 
b. Photos: www.albany.edu/rise2019/rise-photos.html COVID-19

PANDEMIC RESEARCH RESPONSE 
Launched a comprehensive Research Response to the COVID-19 pandemic for the Division and University. This included building a COVID-19 Research Website (https://www.albany.edu/research-guidance/covid-19.html) for institutional guidance, federal guidance across 12 sponsors, funding opportunities, COVID 19 experts pages, and more.

Other resources developed and programs promoted included: 
1. SUNY Seed Funding Program (25 Proposals / 11 Awards) https://bit.ly/3eObIcb 
2. NSF RAPID Notice – http://www.albany.edu/sites/default/files/2020-04/NSF-Rapid-Notice.pdf 
3. NSF EAGER Notice – https://bit.ly/3eZPqod 
4. NIH Notices – https://bit.ly/2ZrlKJJ 
5. Federal Sponsor Guidance – https://www.albany.edu/research-guidance/summary-guidance.html 
6. New Funding Opportunities Site – https://www.albany.edu/researchguidance/federal-sponsors.html 
7. Established COVID-19 Experts Page – http://www.albany.edu/researchguidance/covid-faculty.html 
8. Established Reopening Research Task Force – https://bit.ly/3idM8zw 
9. Conducted Space Utilization & PPE Survey – https://bit.ly/34e4TMN 
10. Developed a Reopening Research Matrix for Those Returning to Campus (Data as of 6/29/2020) – https://bit.ly/3ghBSEr
FY1920.Q103:
There are four modules in the Research BI: Proposals, Incremental Funding, Award Installment, and Expenditure.
1.	Proposal module is tested and ready with data since 7/1/2018.
2.	Award Installment module is under testing for data accuracy. 
3.	Incremental Funding module is under testing for data accuracy
4.	ITS started to create the Expenditure module.
FY1920.Q104:
The Research BI was not launched in FY 2020 because:
1.	The ITS BI Team lead, Hiran Bollapragada, left the University in May 2019. Betty Zhu was hired later that year.
2.	Due to the transition of RF’s proposal management system (from COEUS to PACS), the source data was not 100% compatible with the original module in BI. Since the Research BI project is still in progress, this SMART goal will be carried over to next year (see below). In addition, our Office had decided to start a data visualization project with Power BI and the source data from RF, in order to provide an online, high-level research dashboard for the campus, which will be launched in FY 2021.
FY1920.Q113:
Communications and Marketing (lead) advised that the Division for Research is not yet in the sequence to transition from RedDot to Drupal. 

The Offices continues to plan for the transition to the new Drupal Platform.
FY1920.Q114: Await guidance from Communications and Marketing.
FY1920.Q123:
FACULTY AND GRANTS DEVELOPMENT RESOURCES TO SPUR 
EXTRAMURAL FUNDING:
1.	Cyber – AI Institute / Research Hub Website –  https://ujashm.github.io/CyberAI/home.html ; 
2.	AI – Cyber Seed Funding Program
a.	Website – http://www.albany.edu/aisci/aicsi-seed-funding.html
b.	Abstract – https://www.albany.edu/aisci/about-aicsi.html
3.	Fellowship and Funding Navigator – https://www.albany.edu/studentfunding/index.html ; 
4.	Developing a Faculty Development Cloud-based resource for UAlbany Research Community to Secure Extramural Funding

Developed these Cloud-based resources to support our research community competitiveness in the pursuit of extramural funding.  A number of beta products/applications will be rolled-out over next 3-6 months.
FY1920.1819Mission: Leading the development and implementation of the Divisions strategic priorities, assessment, data analytics and technology initiatives in support of our faculty and researchers efforts to advance research and secure extramural funding.
FY1920.1819Vision: Building a research environment to bolster the success of our scholars in the never-ending pursuit of research excellence through transformative, measurable, and technologically-adept ideas, solutions and supports.
FY1920.1819Goal1: Design and development of an interactive system to measure progress the division’s strategic initiatives
FY1920.1819Activities1:
1.	Explore best practices and technology applications available
2.	Designed new framework
3.	Transition from spreadsheet (current) to new application (future)
FY1920.1819Metrics1:
1.	Establishment of timetable and targets (quantitative)
2.	Ease of use to use new system (qualitative)
FY1920.1819Goal2: Advancing and implementing the high priority, major projects of the VPR/Division.
FY1920.1819Activities2:
1.	Proper planning and preparation (e.g., simplifying, understanding, implementing and FOA guidance).
2.	Ensuring adequate expertise and resources
3.	Development of and adherence to timeline and planned targets
FY1920.1819Metrics2:
1.	Timetable and targets (quantitative)
2.	Successful completion (e.g., submission/awards) (qualitative)
FY1920.1819Goal3: Collaborating with ITS to ensure the Business Intelligence (BI) system for Research is operational, and transition the BI to a more visually appealing format.
FY1920.1819Activities3:
1.	Team up with ITS to ensure that the system’s technical deficiencies are resolved.
2.	Test system to validate data accuracy 
3.	Explore transition system with ITS to a visually friendly application (e.g., Power BI/Tableau)
FY1920.1819Metrics3:
1.	Establishment of timetable and targets (quantitative)
2.	Ease of use to use new system (qualitative)
3.	Administrator, Faculty, Researcher, Staff use of System

FY1920.1920Goal1: Advancing and implementing the high priority, major projects of the VPR/Division to bolster extramural funding and research excellence.
FY1920.1920Activities1: 1.	Proper planning and preparation (e.g., simplifying, understanding, implementing and FOA guidance) – and management of extramural funding proposal development.; 2.	Ensuring adequate expertise and resources; 3.	Development of and adherence to timeline and planned targets;
FY1920.1920Metrics1: 1.	Timetable and targets (quantitative); 2.	Successful completion (e.g., submission/awards) (qualitative);
FY1920.1819Goal4: Transition to the Division’s high-level pages from Red-Dot to Drupal
FY1920.1819Activities4:
1.	Work with and coordinate closely with Communication and Marketing, and their consultant in the transition to Drupal
2.	Solicit and share concepts and plans with the Division’s direct reports. 
3.	Implement transition content to new platform
FY1920.1819Metrics4:
1.	Establishment of timetable and targets (quantitative)
2.	Aesthetic, Navigation and Ease of use to use new system (qualitative)
3.	User web traffic

FY2021.1920Metrics4: 1.	Establishment of timetable and targets (quantitative); 2.	Aesthetic, Navigation and Ease of use to use new system (qualitative); 3.	User web traffic ;
FY2021.1819Goal5: Expanding and refining the development of cloud-based Technology, Tools, Strategies, Resources to enhance the productivity of faculty and researchers in securing extramural funding

1.	Continue to Investigate and Implement Best Practices 
2.	Continue to build-Out Technology Applications  (e.g., SharePoint)
3.	Secure Faculty champion of Domain-Based sites
FY2021.1819Metrics5:
1.	Use of Resources and Sites; Users/Clicks (quantitative)
2.	Brief Satisfaction Survey (qualitative)

FY2021.1920Goal5: Design and development of an interactive system to measure progress the division’s strategic initiatives
FY2021.1920Activities5: 1.	Explore best practices and technology applications available; 2.	Designed new framework; 3.	Transition from spreadsheet (current) to new application (Monday.com and MS Teams). ; 4.	Consideration will be given to scaling these applications Divisionwide.;
